mWRjFG2dbaBSl6lwGgRf5A.text: Yes - I spent my whole day walking around London looking at the touristy stuff while eating and drinking juice bottles. I was short on time, did my walking from place to place, and just felt that I was losing out on time.    I got lost using the Tube and ended up coming up at Oxford to find myself finally sitting down for a sandwich.  I avoided sitting down at all the whole day (except while on the Tube) and only stopped because  I no longer had the energy to walk.  This place rocks with organically grown vegetables and stuff.  Their salads (Greek) was yummy and VERY fresh.  Their cookies were sinfully yet good enough to eat without terrible regrets :)  Their fruit juice selection was huge which I chose Mango something.The selection is huge and compared to Whole Foods' offering, it is much cheaper (to USA's version).   I noticed there is a WHOLE FOODS in London but did not care to visit.They have bar stools and tables inside but the outside had 4 tables. The only down side was that i had to inhale the secondary smoke from neighboring tables.  That is just me.

Ka32aE3Bd59YWB_PtrBHqA.text: There really isn't anything like this on the west coast. I know there's a Pret in NY, but really that's of no use for me since I don't live there. But the sammys here are fresh, delicious, and affordable (for UK terms). I went to Pret a Manger a few times while i was in London and their sandwiches were all good. Even the seafood one I got (crawfish) was good and not fishy tasting. Ahh I'm salivating for a sandwich from them now. They make their sandwiches, salads, wraps, etc. all fresh and the only thing that can make them better would be to have one in CA (I'm thinking downtown SF would be a good place no?)

lnkAMVboAxA-1V_miiyFng.text: OK, so we've been to thr UK 16 times and every time we eat at Pret for lunch. There's practically one on every corner! It simply cannot be beat! Each one is unique in it's own right. The food is extremely fresh, delish and well priced. There's a reason it's full of Londoners eating! Whenever we're in the UK and it's lunchtime, no matter where we are, if there's a Pret around you can find us there! From hot & cold sandwiches to soup, salads, pastries, coffe & tea, you just can't go wrong. A must place for a quick lunch. Forget the burger places...you can go there in the states...be British...eat at Pret!

oTckOaic7g9aeyC3sMHV4g.text: Pret is OK but I feel like I've had better sandwiches.  Maybe I shouldn't have ordered a Jalapeno Chicken Wrap from a place that's thousands of miles away from Mexico and who's staff can't even pronounce it correctly (I mean, ja-LOP-a-no?? really?).  Unless red bell peppers have suddenly turned into hal-a-PAIN-yos, there were none in my wrap.  The coffee was pretty good though.  And I do give them points for being almost as annoyingly everywhere as Starbucks (very convenient if you're looking for a quick bite).  Not bad as a grab-n-go place but not my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom

EpgpSYE7vmaT17x6oazEiQ.text: London is very into its sandwiches and no one does Sandwiches better than Pret.  Hands down, the best Sandwich on earth.  Well done!

Ko9ROyIkaFrpv5P3xU3Vcg.text: I don't care what people say about Pret, I will always like it and I love to grab a quick lunch from here.  I love most of the sandwiches they sell here, which always taste fresh and are replaced on a regular basis.  They also have some really great soup options during the winter days, which unlike other similar chains tends to actually taste of their actual ingredient which is reassuring.  I have also recently discovered their hot wraps which were a pleasant surprise as well.  Also good on the menu are the brownies, carrot cakes, butter croissants, and cheesecakes.  You know, the funny thing about this chain though is that it is actually partially owned by McDonald's!  Oh well... that won't stop me from coming here.

xJhj-Yl-T03H3MjDjCESsQ.text: This place is everywhere even in DC. This was the perfect place to pick up a nicely wrap sandwich to  bring with your trip to the airport. Make sure you get it made fresh, because I grab a pre-wrap and it was hard as a brick. I got a fresh made one and it was really good pesto and chicken.

hGRBUQ2SVt1GlH0xxk_gBA.text: Have to update with a suggestion:Today I bought the tuna baguette and the tomato soup. I took the cucumbers out of the baguette, sprinkled salt on them and had them as my 'appetizer'. Then I dipped the tuna baguette into the tomato soup and oooooohhhhh man was that GOOD! Give it a try~

6AFrgGYfyAQvGN10BwWK5w.text: Love Bars are simply the best food on earth. Every time I find myself in London, even just passing through Heathrow, I hightail it to the closest Pret and buy them out of Love Bars. I then bring them home and covet them, rationing them out, only to eventually run out and anticipate the next time I or someone else will be in London to retrieve more. If I could eat one, and only one thin for the rest of my life it would be a Love Bar. Thanks for sharing your love with me Pret a Manger, now please open up in Chicago.

OHRncOiQH_XwCx4EMLOlxg.text: Good to grab a quick lunch from, and what I really like about this place is that, unlike so many places which sell sandwich produce, they do sandwiches with no mayo, which I'm not really a fan of. Pret a manger ('Ready To Eat') is a chain which prides themselves for producing 'natural handmade food with no added preservatives or additives'. They provide customers with a wide range of food which caters to all sorts of taste buds: Sandwiches (such as Scottish smoked salmon with lemon juice to falafel, spinach & tomato), daily soups (lentil and bacon, sag-aloo, Thai chicken curry) , baguettes, hot wraps, sushi (surprisingly good), and salads. They also do a decent selection of cakes (the banana card box cake is pretty good), desserts and a range of baked goods such as croissants and muffins. In addition to food they do 'Just Roasted' coffees, teas, hot chocolates and juices. I wish the prices were a little cheaper, but the quality isn't bad, so all in all I would say they did pretty good 'fast food'.

MK8cshxM-ePXIAAUxZjzjQ.text: Despite a bad first experience in Pret, I went back recently and had a really nice lunch. I had a Mexican chicken wrap with corn soup and a can of coke. The whole thing came to about £7 though which is a little steep. Despite the sandwich being a bit cold and soggy, it went really well with the soup which was piping hot, really filling and creamy. There isn't waiter service as this is a place to grab a quick lunch, so pay at the counter and bring it to the table yourself. This isn't McDonald's though so you're not expected to clean up after yourself too! It can be manic at lunchtime so try going at about 3pm, some of the good stuff will be sold out but the soup usually stays around till then and at least you'll get a seat.

C37FMLU2ZIvWLQDLYcsVWg.text: I suppose Pret's offerings aren't anything too out of the ordinary. Still, they do what they do well, and I quite enjoy it. Pret quickly became one of my favorite places to grab a quick bite in London. The prices aren't too bad, and the food made me feel at least somewhat healthy. I also like some of their unique combinations of different things in their sandwiches. It keeps things interesting and gives me another reason to keep coming back.

ZtvVCB3KhGCC2_hADkBaaA.text: a milli a milli x better than Subway and Quizno'sand more portable tooit's not the vibe you're used to as far as bread, size, and packaging goit's freshness supreme, not just cold deli cuts.and be bold: chicken salad and smoked salmon are my favz

RcM4e2en2vqcrhRVNA3ngw.text: Wet, cold, damp, moist. Those are the words that jump to mind when I think of a sandwich from Pret. How people in the UK actually rate Pret is beyond me. In other countries you go into a deli counter and get them to make whatever you want, you've got to settle for this rubbish here.

FwLtZnXDcLAoe-rKw5ysHQ.text: I love Pret. I wish they would migrate over the Atlantic and join me in Canada. This place is amazing and surprisingly affordable. The croissants and sandwiches are fresh and delicious. My favorite is the BLT; it was so good that I was afraid to try other sandwiches.

hjwW6QCgBhRIkUQyb5-p4A.text: It is such a shame this sandwich shop has not made it to the west coast of the US. While in London, I survived off of the duck wrap and the avocado wrap with pine nuts. This cafe has a multitude of sandwich and wrap options, and everything is organic and made fresh. A great place to grab coffee or to buy already made sandwiches when you are on the go. The Greek yogurt with honey or with homemade granola is a great snack.

8GeY4RUF4zPFg_W9kWeC2Q.text: A great fast food chain. I just needed a good sandwhich on the go and I bought a delicious bacon sandwich. If you pass by it have a peek!!

iGHAn_Isll32DUyfUfWz6g.text: Pret a Manger is a trendy and fullfilling sandwich shop. Not nearly as cool as Sheetz back in The States but always busy and pumping out seemingly fresh salads and sandwiches. In addition as we Americans take the financial beatdown for traveling across the pond, its an easy choice as the prices here are expected and normal for us. I am not going to lie though! All of the conveniences of the world cannot mask the English crave of mayo. 95% of all the products there are lathered in mayo, seriously. Otherwise they definately would have gotten another star. It's not enough to hate the mayo but I hate when the restaurant doesnt provide enough options. Thirty different sandwiches and only 2 without the junk.

7Z1OzYiGdfFiARrzwrN2sQ.text: Pret shops are all over London, including Heathrow, and I had the opportunity to stop in a couple of times for Brie and Tomato on a baguette.  I don't know if this a French chain, but the sandwiches rivaled those that I have had in Paris, and the price seemed lower as well (around three pounds for most sandwiches).  Excellent coffee as well. And friendly service which was appreciated.  My advice is to stay the hell away from Subways, which abound throughout London, and seek out Pret.

CJUMZExjO56ZbUD9CTx8Lw.text: Definately a huge fan of Pret, especially if you're on a budget or just want something to go that is fresh and dare i say healthy.  Sandwiches, soups, and pastries were great tasting.  We made the mistake of trying E.A.T.  Tesco sandwiches also can't compare.  You can't go wrong with Pret in terms of quality, taste, and presentation.

v1DEaE16PqKsCLFw7aPQrw.text: If you want a fresh sandwich or salad, head to Pret a manger. The prices aren't ridiculously high like most decent sandwich shops you find in London. You will find that the menu changes daily with a variety of soups and hot sandwichs alternating. The sandwiches remain mainly the same with a different one or two changing for the time of year. They have a couple salads, but not a large variety which I wish they would make some more!They have some healthy snacks like apples, banana's, dried fruit, yogurt covered nuts, snack bars, and skinny popcorn. Suitable for vegetarians and carnevours. Pret has started to serve soy latte's and at a better price that you can find at costa or starbucks but just the same quality product and even speedier service. The ambience is pretty sterile, with clean lines and not a lot of frills. Just a few stools and seats around to enjoy a quick bite and head out if you're not just grabbing your food to go.

2K_oLQI_P2aqW3WZFNAHvQ.text: As somebody said in one of the reviews, if you've been to one you've been to it all. This place is just everywhere in London like a starbucks back in the U.S.  known for its pre-made sandwiches, salads, and anything you want to eat on the go.  Sandwiches are ok, dont expect it to be great since they are pre-made.  Also tried the coffee - not bad but I usually like my coffee a little stronger. If you live and work in London then this place is perfect for getting food on the go.

ydvtoxGfHAl4gYwvsJQgMQ.text: To EAT or to Pret?  The dilemma that plagues every Londoner.  But I'd say Pret's sweet chili prawn wrap trumps everything.  I've memorized the ingredient list on the back of the wrapper so I can make it myself later.  Prawns, cilantro, cucumber, sweet chili sauce-so simple yet so freaking delicious.Pret please get yoself over to the states.  I'll miss you dearly.

z4dxBxIe1Gxd_-cN9vpHxA.text: Love Pret. Wish they had it in other cities... It comes close to Itsu, but is second in my books for lunch stops in London, which is why it gets 4 stars vs 5 stars.There are locations pretty much everywhere (it's like Starbucks) but this one was the closest to my work. The barristas/servers are funny and friendly - which is pretty amazing given their location just above Oxford Tube station and on the High Street. The place is always packed but they manage to keep the line moving and you laughing during the order process.Breakfast:- I usually get the hot granola (with skim milk) and a cappuccino (also with skim milk) - yum! The croissants are amazing but not as good for the waistline on a regular basis!Lunch:- I usually get the falafal or the chicken/avocado sandwich but sometimes mix it up with a salad (the hummus or mozzarella salads are both delicious). The juices and sparkling drinks are also really unique and refreshing so stock up on those.Big fan. Clearly.

c10cQSVgXPCMMj7sLTd5ww.text: Love this place! Coffee is great, service is nice and quick. I had the shrimp and avocado salad which was great. Awesome place for a quick snack. Sisters had the croissant and enjoyed it.

7tOUWxGysXdjGwXbWKEFRw.text: Is 'Pret' World Domination too much to ask for? They need to open up a SF/Oakland location stat! Pret has everything you can possibly want - sandwiches, baguettes, wraps, sushi, soups, salads, cakes, cookies,  crisps, and coffee. My favorites are the egg & bacon baguette and the chicken & avocado sandwich. Not only is this my go to lunch spot in London but I love starting my day at Pret with a latte and almond croissant.All the food is freshly made in the store's adjoining kitchen and placed on shelves immediately for you to grab and go. It's additive and preservative free for the most part and any food left on the shelves at closing time is donated to charity.

PLZ0eHBWlcidpw-h6RVCuw.text: Here's a thought. Let's get rid of every single Starbucks in the world and replace them with a Pret A Manger. My first day in London in February of 2009, I stumbled upon this little sandwich/coffee shop by accident. I had a large latte and a croissant stuffed with ham and cheese. It was delicious, considering this place reminded me of a Starbucks, only a million times better. For what I paid, the quality was great. I wish I remembered every single last detail from Pret's, but I just remember how much I loved the breakfast that morning. I guess it had really hit the spot for me. When I go back to London I'll definitely be eating there again.

mpmFrdJWOT411mps63LKOA.text: It's decent if you are okay with bland, tasteless sandwiches, but don't want to eat at McDonald's.For that, I am giving 3 stars as a wide spread alternative to junk food places.Personally if you can make it to a Chipotle or an Itsu, it's a better choice than Pret a Manger.Healthy and organic doesn't have to mean tasteless!!!!!

57N_Yh9IcWdn5DHeDsx7yA.text: I had been EXTREMELY suspicious of the concept of cardboard boxed sandwiches that can be bought in pretty much any store. I'm sure this is directly related to gastral-intestinal-distressing truck stop sandwiches... None the less, I was talked into giving them a chance. Decided to start at a Pret a Manger. They can be found pretty much on every other block in central London. Probably should have started easier (BLT, egg salad, etc.), but opted for wild crawfish on wheat bread with mayo, lemon juice, and arugula. A bit of a revelation. It was very late in the day, but the sandwich tasted fresh and well-seasoned. Very good - I'm now a convert!

UrDLKnsmKjXXqg-5sVUWqA.text: I actually went to the Pret at 556 Oxford Street about 10 times during my recent stay in London, but I wasn't able to find that one on here...Super fresh food, they make it the same day and sell it the same day. Anything that's left, they give to homeless shelters. The soups were fabulous (I had tomato basil, an Indian soup, a bean soup and one other I can't recall). The sandwiches are large and filling. And, there's free-wi-fi (though I couldn't find any plugs for my computer). Pret's are all over London now, can't wait to go back.

ii4iZBcHs0x0Jr99U4gDiw.text: Pret definitely make the best sandwiches!  My current favourite is their Coronation Chicken... with Avocardo Chicken coming a close second.  And, if I feel in need of a treat, their almond croissants are the best!  Sadly my waistline can't cope with too many of those though! :-(As a regular Pret customer, I also love their Pret Card system... it's a pre-pay card than can be automatically topped up when it drops to a certain level of credit.  So no more scrabbling around for loose change for a cup of coffee or having to go to the cash machine before buying a sandwich!

a1XrQfwn7Dao2c_YsSabmA.text: I love them. I wish they were here in LA, but alas that is another story. The sandwiches are made fresh daily from their own kitchen on site or close by. I'm a big fan of their club sandwich and their egg sandwich. Besides having sandwiches they have a variety of morning pastries, and fruits as well. They are all over London, but that doesn't take away from them one bit! Definitely stop by one if you see it!

cTHXsK2Fh-rUsOU-Mpevbw.text: Pret... ah Pret. The brainchild of a sandwich genuis, Pret offers a delicious alternative to a Subway, Starbucks or *shudder* a Greggs pastie.The most awesomest lunchtime meal combos are:* For the usual, everyday lunchLemonade in a tinAvocado Chicken sandwich (put the pine nuts back in!)Sea Salt and Cider Vinegar crisplesLemon Cheesecake* For a healthy, detox lunchVitamin VolcanoMiso soupMango and lime chunks* For a cold, winters' dayHot Chocolate!Mozzarella and Tomato pastryLeek and Potato SoupChocolate Brownie* By request... here's my combo for a hot, summer's day:Elderflower in a TinFeta and Olive No Bread SaladSome kind of Chili crispsLemon CheesecakeI do love their coffee too, and the fact you can order the chef to make you a fresh sandwich with anything added or minused. "Chef, make me a chicken avocado sandwich with lettuce leaves, none of that hard, crispy lettuce neither. Also, add some of that ceasar dressing and pine leaves while you're at it. Go go! And hurry!"It's no-nonsese, honest food, at good prices and their menu just gets better and better.

zRFx9vroGqlmBSHIX1Q_kA.text: I wouldn't normally review a chain like this, BUT if you want to do some people watching and eat an admittedly nice sandwich then this is your place. Pret do all sorts of yummy varieties and takes on classic favourites. I do like the generous salads if I am being healthy, although they seem to have stopped the tuna nicose they have a new morrocan one out with houmous and falafel and other soul bettering foods. The Soups are a cheaper and filling option. OR the miso soup really does heal any illness and give you a bit of a boost.Pret is nice to just sit in and watch people pass by the window. And you can always pick up a pudding when you finish your sandwich, as I end up doing- the love bars or pecan pie is AMAZING. The prices are not so low, BUT what would you rather have- a hoisin duck wrap, a tea and a cheesecake or a triple whooper bacon extra cheese road to heart attack?

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom

VJUf0JLbawB3FpzDw_VxkQ.text: Any Pret A Manger location is packed during lunch time as it seems to be the number one stop for convenient, fast and delicious meals.  They offer fruits, breads, all kinds of drinks, coffee, salads, parfaits, and these wonderful pre-packaged delicious sandwiches made fresh daily.  Definitely a place ideal for people on-the-go.  They offer Pret A Mangers in New York now (again, for people on-the-go).  How about Los Angeles, huh?  We need you!I had chance to try their Chicken Avocado Sandwich which was fresh and divine.  Delicious, simple and inexpensive - 2 pounds.  Seating would be hard around lunch time ... I was lucky to find a seat though.  Definitely not a place to lounge around to relax.  Now only if they had pre-packaged handsome men on shelf one with characteristic condiments/add-ons like humor, humility, confidence and ambition ... Pret A Manger would get 10 stars from me!

x1URvtQEO5fILyEJGlQ0kA.text: For busy working people on the go, a warm wrap will clear the skies on a bleak and dreary London evening. The wrap itself has drastic room for improvement, but I suspect it depends on how long the sandwich has been sitting on the hot rack for. Because I am from California and consume large amounts of Mexican or Mediterranean food, I am critical of the quality of wraps. Pret A Manger will certainly suffice over other fast food alternatives. However, brace yourself for lines and limited seating during rush hours. Luckily, there are armfuls of Pret A Mangers located throughout London.

wsdOPZ8XdE5D_4iX2-aJJA.text: I am officially a Pret addict!! SO GOOD!!!! YUM!!This sandwich chain is essentially on every street corner in London, but don't disregard its quality because of this. All of its sandwiches are handmade in-store and consists of an interesting variety that extends far beyond turkey with mayo. My favorite sandwich is the Chicken-Avocado with yogurt sauce.. mmmmmmm. I must mention that all of the sandwiches are made ahead of time and placed out in boxes minutes before they are bought.. I'm pretty sure you can customize them if that is your desire though.There is an pre-made sandwich epidemic in London and every cafe, bar, and restaurant seems to have hopped on the bandwagon. Pret, however, is a cut above the rest and will remain my favorite sandwich place in London.

WDwy7d2eIUx1ulbrVJ3wWA.text: Great fresh food on the go. I really wish they would bring Pret to the U.S (other then New York). The Sandwiches are amazing and fresh. They coffee is great. What more could you ask for!  The Best: The warm cheese ham croissant is so tasty. The Bad: Still not on the West Cost in the US.

-Oox5F7kfVZuR2pBikE9EA.text: I'm pretty sure this was the finest thing I put in my mouth the entire time I was in London. The sandwiches were fresh and amazing, the salads were great, and the selection of fruits, pastries and beverages was far more than I'd ever expect from this type of establishment.I can't wait for the day that Pret expands further into the US.

qnan_lcKNLddKIyRI3GObA.text: Great premade breakfast/salads/sandwiches/wraps, juices, coffee and tea.  Love this location since Cumberland next door is our London layover hotel.  Service is always friendly and fast.  This is the go-to place to pick up a quick snack and coffee before heading to Heathrow for the flight home.

IJa6WJ5fiASWEnuzht2bXg.text: Every time I go to U.K., this is my go-to place for breakfast.   I find their food very fresh and staff quite welcoming !

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom. Nut bar, porridge and carrot juice

zuRxfWS6GBvI-4HTozFr1Q.text: Really wide variety of meal choices at an affordable price. My go-to place whenever I pass through London.

UVAwwbU6ehF77YehsYVsbg.text: When I travelled in London, I went to Pret A Manger.There are a lot of Prets in London conveniently located near stations and on high streets.They sell not only just coffee, most importantly, healthy lunch at reasonable prices, too! I am from Japan and In London, everything is really expensive but I loved the large cup of healthy hot soup with a lot of vegetables and chicken with a bread.Other cafes like Starbucks only sell snack and sandwiches which are far too sweet or too much strong tasted sauces, which kills delicate flavour of the ingredients and it seems this kind of too much tasting paralyse our sense of taste with full of delicately cooked food sold in Japan and other Asian countries.When I comes back to London, I will definitely use Pret A Manger again.

pnXHUX8a75Ton4cy7DUHQA.text: I've been coming to this location daily for the past three days, since it's just a couple minutes walk from my hotel.  It's a chain restaurant here in London, offering baked goods, coffee, and of course sandwiches in a crinkly, biodegradable plastic bag!My favorite breakfast item is the smoked salmon and egg salad sandwich.  It has a few sprouts to add some balance.  For some reason, the salty smoked salmon and creamy egg salad goes very well together.  Like my other favorite lunch sandwich place, Paul, they use long, crunchy baguette  breads which makes it easy to eat.Both the chocolate and almond croissants are also excellent - very flakey and crispy if you like that.  It's not very dense but very tasty - a perfect way to end the meal without being overly full.

9USR8MPzRTXTcRGYyet4Kw.text: Another common chain around London. Cheap, yummy, fast, etc. I prefer Pret A Manger to EAT. I really like the croissants and coffee, but especially for the soup. Def recommend the mushroom risotto soup. You'll see a lot of locals stopping by here to grab coffee or lunch during their lunch break. The staff are always really nice to. Overall, I have only positive experiences at all Pret A Mangers Ive been to and only positive things to say. The fact that I just found out they have them in the US makes me happy also.

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom

_ZXwnj4nUQKfj_grw-oYWQ.text: Pret A Manger started to pop up around Washington DC a few years back so that was my first introduction to this franchise.This location was conveniently located right outside of my hotel (The Cumberland) and it was great.  Fantastic selection of sandwiches, snacks, drinks, soups, etc...

qDsCKooorRyl_KfbVJhVzQ.text: Busy street and busy cafe but speedy service. I came in during the lunch rush and I had just missed a large group of tourists which probably explains the rushed customer service but it was understandable and not a total mood-killer. I've had the smoked salmon and butter sandwich (£2.5) and the ham cheese and tomato croissant (£1.8).The sandwich was simple and light, just the way I like my sandwiches.But, I can say that the croissant was definitely my favorite!Melted cheese harmonizing with the ham and tomato in a perfectly seasoned croissant- I felt like I was eating a mini-pizza. So addictive that I crave this croissant- totally worth the 450 calories!

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom. ham cheese tomato croissant
Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom. ham cheese tomato croissant and smoked salmon and butter sandwich

--Aook6kS-GGO118DV8OiA.text: I come to this place quite often and only because I am trying to eat healthy because I find their food slightly tasteless. I know it's fresh but I wish they also used good quality ingredients which is not the case. I cannot drink their coffee - it's too bitter. Some of their salads are not too bad. The service is quite efficient also hence I'm giving them 3 stars.

AggWCdPuvqvtqwfASOUdfw.text: I love Pret A Manger in New York, but it cannot compare to the London version.  The spicy crawfish sandwich is something that would make New Orleans proud!  The croissants, and other variety here are something I hope wil be brought to the USA!   Pret a Manger deserves credit for helping make London one of the world's great culinary cities.

vpC6gS52BSN933QsTh9LRw.text: Great place with absolutely lovely staff. I used to visit this place every morning and I always found the food and staff to be perfect. Extremely healthy food here. Their slogan is "Made today, gone tomorrow". I have no idea how accurate this is but everything I buy from their various branches (which is a lot) always seems as fresh as it can be.The only thing I didn't like was how quickly their really good stuff sells out but other than that, top marks all round.

Tdh_J5iEyUYHEMUhedUdeA.text: My family and I were on our way to the Bond Street tube stop and were in great need of some breakfast before starting out our dayventure. The doors to a stubby little mall opened, and low and behold, Pret A Manager was beaming right at us. The croissants here are fresh, delicate, and oh so tasty for a reasonable price! The mozzarella and tomato croissants were delicious and not too cheesy. But the real winner in my book were the chocolate croissants. They're filled with a surprisingly large amount of chocolate inside of them. With each bite you got a taste of real cocoa with your fluffy croissant. They have something called a babyccino which is basically a cappucino minus the coffee for kids. It's free and in a very small cup. The cappuccino here was delicious and went very well with my croissants in the morning. Pret A Manager was definitely one of my favorite places for breakfast in London. Now if only they opened up one in California... :)

YDwmQCvu7GYL_LIKuWXZrw.text: These were located everywhere all over London and similar to a over-priced Starbucks.They boast that they have very 'healthy' and organic types of food but when we arrived, all we saw that we'd like was from the bakery.Two croissants, some small (very small) fruit cups & a bottle of water ran us about $20. It was definitely over-priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Pret A Manger - London, United Kingdom. Our light snack

wAlcpbTt-SLVZAsHHN8U-g.text: Being in London for the first time, I saw this EVERYWHERE! It is like the equivalent of Starbucks in the states.  They have a wonderful variety of foods to choose from.If you're in a rush to catch all the attractions and want a quick but pretty good bite I suggest stopping by Pret a Manger.I had the chicken avocado and a squash soup which were both delicious! Everything seemed pretty fresh.  The best part like I said was it was quick!

9BBpRW3-Cpx1YEaaGTgVwQ.text: I think Pret is pretty marvelous. I think if it swallowed and replaced every chain sub shop in America I would feel no loss. And quite a bit of gain.The food theme is admirable on a level with our Chipotle: decent, less-processed ingredients assembled fairly simply and fresh every day. I don't THINK the baguettes are fully leavened non-shortcut bread, but unlike our Subway/Jimmy John's/Quiznos/Penn Station/Firehouse/Blimpie/etc. I can't be quite sure: they are actually crusty outside and moist/chewy inside. There is that real-food satisfaction and satiety. And it's NOT expensive, even in London. I recall paying about 3 pounds for a very satisfying ham & cheddar sandwichIt's a knockoff of the mind-blowing independent boulangerie-based sandwich shops you can find in Paris, and a quite serviceable one at that. The best "staple" fast food I think I've ever come across.

r-eRZUfOWYEVl7EbFTnwFQ.text: I love this place for what it is: a quick place to get salads/sandwiches/lunch item-type foods when you're in a hurry. They have a great selection of different salads, sandwiches, etc. for those who are on the go. We were trying to catch the train to Nice and just needed something to eat for the train ride. This was perfect. Also, the food is pretty good and hits the spot.

H9xxRw6Y1E1GDH3I2gX8iQ.text: Really 3.5 star, but I'm in a generous, rounding up sort of mood. Predictable. Reliable. Words that, in my youth, I negatively used to describe used cars and unwanted suitors. I wanted new, exciting, explosive experiences every. time. I. ate (or dated). Now that I've aged, my preferences have changed. I'm not trying to roll the damn dice every time I get a sandwich. To that end, Pret a Manager is like a nice Ford Taurus- Pret a Manger is consistently reliable and pretty good.  You want a particular sandwich, you come here and you get the same thing , each and every time. They're pretty darn tasty too.

Dh91fqg1QUHy2uis1ZD65Q.text: I have three words for you.... Cheese And Pickle This is BY FAR the best sandwich on the planet & Pret A Manger serves it up right For those not in the know (USA), Pret offers shelves & shelves of packed sandwiches......but they are FRESHLY made & ready to go.  Get your regular  fav lunch sandwich & get out the door that much quicker b/c your delish sandwich is already madeAmericans tend to have this preconceived notion that anything already in the triangle packaging must be old, moldy & terrible......hear me now!  This is not the case w/ PretWhether on sliced bread or a baguette, you will find the below yummiliscious fillings: Mature Cheddar Cheese Branston Pickle Watercress If you're lucky, you'll also get sun-dried tomatoes like I had on my baguette today & that just kicks it up a notch Pret also makes their own Crisps & I can highly recommend the Cheddar & Onion Super-crispy & tons of cheesy flavor w/ none of that MSG we Americans tend to put in all our bags of chips Three cheers for Pret A Manger & it's best three-ingredient sandwich!!

7CUOeIC7R4j95l8GA6ISxg.text: First time chicken avocado! My favourite instantly!Pea and mint soup? Yes, please! Just add the fresh carrot juice and I'll be forever happy. And Staff members only make it look better and cozy.. even if it's full with people they are fast enough to serve all.And here I go again, 30 mins recharging with quality food and I'm ready for more shopping at West1's.

0YihpzQ8th9hgfvyNf4-Tg.text: I asked my hotel manager for a casual place to eat that was not a chain thinking he was going to tell me to go to Mc Donalds.  Well...he told me to go to Pret a Manger ...while is a chain...he said there food is very good and they give anything they don't sell at the end of the day to the homeless...sounds cool.You go in and there are open refrigerators that have all different kinds of sandwiches mostly baguette. At lunch, they have hot wraps too.  You bring your selection to the counter where you can also purchase soup, coffee, or tea.  They have a take away and eat in price.  The price to take it away is about 50 pence less per item than eating in.   Genius!!   I never had to find a table even during the busy lunch hour...I had the Thai Chili Chicken which was delish...  It's like chicken salad with Sweet Thai Chili sauce.  The baguette that the chicken is housed in is VERY fresh and with a slight crisp outside.  It really reminded me of a Banh Mi.  The price was under 3 pounds.  They also make yummy breakfast baguettes.  I had the egg and bacon.  And the egg is basically egg salad.  Thought that was weird but it tasted pretty good.   One morning I did stop in hoping to grab some lunch stuff for an all day bus tour but they don't sell the lunch till later...A few days into my London trip, and I realize this place is like Starbucks is to Seattle.  You will not have trouble finding one or several in close proximity. They are all about using local in season ingredients, they donate to the homeless and they are OCD about recycling (will see signs on the wall everywhere).  Really wish there was one of these in the US.  Highly recommend!!  Well ..not really because you'll probably end up there anyways...lol.

j2UnpgchRqQ-EiYYH-pI5A.text: I frequented Pret quite a lot when i lived in London and was working due to my short lunch breaks and the fact we would eat in the office because I could grab what I wanted quickly and it always was very fresh and I had a lot of choices. It never seemed like fast food and there was always something really tasty. I really enjoyed the brie sandwich with tomatoes? I think that is what it had in it, possibly with basil.They also had several soup options which I quite frequently chose as well along with a small salad. I really never had anything from Pret that I didn't like. My only complaint was that so many of the sandwiches had mayo on them which I am not a huge fan of but I got over it. I would try and take some off or just pick ones that didn't have any on it. Pret was definitely one of the most affordable options as I always got food out during my lunch breaks (lazy I know but my schedule was hectic!) and it was easy to pick something healthy and yummy. They also have healthy snacks like fresh fruit, dried fruit, snack bars, etc., which were easy to grab if if I was starving before jumping on the tube.
